description: Similar Items 13. %IMAGEREPLACED% Add to Bookbag Form and good in Plato's Eleatic dialogues: the Parmenides, Theaetetus, Sophist, and Statesman Dorter, Kenneth 1940- University of California Press,  1994 Classics | Philosophy | Classical Literature and Language In this innovative analysis, Plato's four eleatic dialogues are treated as a continuous argument. In Kenneth Dorter's view, Plato reconsiders the theory of forms propounded in his earlier dialogues and through an examination of the theory's limitations reaffirms and proves it essential.
